Abstract: Michael Wines article on what will become of Russia in next century, given its lost sense of purpose after end of the cold war, its history of being ruled by strongmen and its suspicion of or hostility to the outside world; photo (M)
Snippet: Michael Wines article on what will become of Russia in next century, given its lost sense of purpose after end of the cold war, its history of being ruled by strongmen and its suspicion of or hostility to the outside world; photo (M)
LeadParagraph: ANYONE trying to divine the next step on Russia's wandering course toward nationhood might start with this arresting fact: the last time Russians lived within borders as constricted as the current ones, Ivan the Terrible had been dead for only a few decades, St. Petersburg was a frozen swamp, and New York City was still the property of the Dutch.

Headline.Main: Missing in Russia: A History and a Purpose
Headline.PrintHeadline: VISIONS: POWER; Missing in Russia: A History and a Purpose
